hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done.

Summary.

If you’re up for it, you can continue with this mission.

mission description

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on making a self-compassion toolbox. An action plan for when we are in need.

We’ll be doing an audio exercise followed by time for reflection and finally sharing with each other, if we are up to it.

Heads up that you'll need pen and paper for this exercise.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text:
Practice making a self-compassion toolbox – an action plan for when we are in need. 

Heads up that you'll need pen and paper for this exercise.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

How do you feel about creating your own toolbox?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: How do you feel about creating your own toolbox?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: How do you feel about creating your own toolbox?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. We've just created a toolbox of behaviors to do when we loose our footing. 

If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

Next time you experience a difficult or challenging situation, like the ones you described during this session, try out your emergency toolbox. Notice what happens to you, and your behaviors.

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done. We've just created a toolbox of behaviors to do when we loose our footing. 

If you’re up for it, you can continue with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

Next time you experience a difficult or challenging situation, like the ones you described during this session, try out your emergency toolbox. Notice what happens to you, and your behaviors.

en.name: Self-compassion toolbox

coCreators.name: Kristin Neff & Chris Germer, CMSC, original research

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: When we are under pressure it is easy to forget to be self-compassionate. Create a toolbox so that you have a clear to do-list for the times when you are in need. It can help us be more resilient in challenging situations.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

Bem-vindo(a). Eu sou X e hoje vamos trabalhar por cerca de 30 minutos em xx.

Faremos xx, por exemplo, uma meditação, seguida de um tempo para reflexão e compartilhamento entre nós.

Vamos começar com um check-in rápido. Como você está se sentindo agora? Responda em duas ou três palavras. X, você gostaria de começar?

Deixe que cada pessoa do grupo, inclusive você, faça seu check-in, um de cada vez.

Obrigado a todos por compartilharem. Vamos começar.

Encontre uma posição confortável. Vou iniciar o exercício em áudio e, depois, nos encontramos aqui novamente.

>Aperte o play para começar o exercício em áudio.

Agora vamos tirar 1 minuto para refletir individualmente.

xxPergunta principal

xxExplicações adicionais sobre a pergunta, se necessário.

Você pode anotar suas ideias em um papel ou apenas mentalmente. Não existe certo ou errado aqui — cada resposta é pessoal. O tempo de 1 minuto começa agora.

Aperte o play para iniciar o cronômetro.

Pronto, 1 minuto se passou. Vamos seguir em frente.

Agora vamos para a parte de compartilhamento. Temos três regras para esse momento:

1. **O que é dito aqui, fica aqui.

2. **Tudo o que você precisa fazer é ouvir. Não é preciso consertar, ajudar ou dar conselhos. Estamos aqui apenas para escutar e explorar juntos o que cada um está vivendo.

3. **Tudo o que sentimos por dentro é válido. Raiva, amor, ódio, tristeza — qualquer sentimento que surgir. Não existe certo ou errado. É o que é.

Vamos usar um cronômetro de 2 minutos como referência. Se você não quiser compartilhar, pode simplesmente dizer “passo”.

Quem gostaria de começar?

>Deixe que cada pessoa compartilhe, uma de cada vez, conforme o tempo disponível. Aperte o play para iniciar o cronômetro e reinicie a cada nova partilha.

Muito obrigado a todos.

Muito bem! Se quiser, você pode levar o que começamos aqui hoje para a sua vida cotidiana, colocando em prática essa missão:

xx descrição da missão

Antes de encerrarmos, vamos fazer um check-out rápido.

Como você está se sentindo agora? Algo mudou? Responda em duas ou três palavras.

Quem gostaria de começar?

Deixe que cada pessoa faça seu check-out, uma de cada vez.

Obrigado a todos por compartilharem e por participarem da sessão de hoje.

Finalize a sessão para encaminhar todos para a experiência de encerramento.

content.text:
Muito bem.

Resumo.

Se quiser, você pode continuar com esta sugestão:

descrição da sugestão

hostNotes.text: >Comece a sessão quando estiver pronto para seguir
